name: Northern Treeshrew
description: It has a slender body, elongated snout, five-fingered limbs with sharp claws, and a long, bushy tail. Its coloration is olive-green to gray, lighter underneath. Males are larger than females and have light fur around the eyes.
image_alt: Northern Treeshrew, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 12–15 cm, tail length 13–16 cm, weight 125–160 g
attractions: Though it seems unbelievable, treeshrews are closely related to primates. Most species are active during the day, nimbly foraging in tree canopies and on the ground.
breeding: We’ve kept treeshrews since 2001 and bred them since 2002.
